abstract: Wendy R Sherman, Pres Obama's chief negotiator with Iran and No 3 official at State Dept, announces she will leave administration shortly after June 30 deadline for Iran nuclear agreement; planned departure, following those of other top officials who negotiated with Iran over past two years and left, has legislators wondering who will implement deal if one is made.
lead_paragraph: With the departure of Wendy R. Sherman, all the top negotiators on Iran since 2013 will have left the administration, leaving questions about who will help carry out a deal if one is struck.

headline.main: Obama’s Chief Negotiator in Iran Nuclear Talks Plans to Depart After Deadline for Deal
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Chief Negotiator in Iran Talks Plans to Depart After Deadline for Deal

snippet: With the departure of Wendy R. Sherman, all the top negotiators on Iran since 2013 will have left the administration, leaving questions about who will help carry out a deal if one is struck.
